title: Actions by members
context: [ยง428-410] Actions by members. (a) A member may maintain an action against a limited liability company or another member for legal or equitable relief, with or without an accounting as to the company&rsquo;s business, to enforce: (1) The member&rsquo;s rights under the operating agreement; (2) The member&rsquo;s rights under this chapter; and (3) The rights and otherwise protect the interests of the member, including rights and interests arising independently of the member&rsquo;s relationship to the company. (b) The accrual, and any time limited for the assertion, of a right of action for a remedy under this section shall be governed by other laws. A right to an accounting upon dissolution and winding up does not revive a claim barred by law. [L 1996, c 92, pt of ยง1]
